name: Advocate Jagjeet Kaur Rehel
about: Advocate Jagjeet Kaur Rehel completed her law in the year 1984 and has been providing services in various fields of law, that is, Family, Landlord/ Tenant, Divorce, Consumer Court, Documentation and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents.
Advocate Jagjeet enrolled with the Bar Council of Maharashtra & Goa in 1984. She is a member of the Bombay Bar Association.

questions_answered.question: Steps required to file for Divorce
questions_answered.answer: A Divorced Petition  is to be drafted supported by  necessary documents like married Photographs, age, residence, salary proof  and other documents if any supporting affidavit .  the Petition  is to  be filed in the Court of your Jurisdiction.

questions_answered.question: Can I close my room in pagadi system?
questions_answered.details: I live in Bhandup with my dad.area is too small for me.then I bought a new house in Andheri .and I move to Andheri with my dad and stay there for few month.a few days back my landlord call me and told me u not closed ur room. u have to live there.otherwise,I will sue u and file case against u.and u lost your home. I don't understand what will I do.I need a solution for this. because he does not give me permission to take subtenant in this flat. and I also don't want to sale m flat also.
questions_answered.answer: Closing room without an appropriate reason is a ground(Non User of more than 6 months ) for eviction, you said that you  have also bought  another premises and hance created second ground( alternative Premises)  in favour of the landlord for eviction against you. Please show some most essential reason for leaving said Premises  and also not disclosing the Landlord.  Please visit premises get some evidence like electricity other bills etc., to show that u are in need of the same and your shifting is necesssary. Other wise Court will pass Order against you.

questions_answered.question: What can I do if my husband starts harassing me after dismissal?
questions_answered.details: if the court has dismissed or closed the case and husband starts harassing again what step can be taken?
questions_answered.answer: Party who is not obeying the Orders/ Judgments passed, are liable for the Contempt of Court and  be arrested.  After making an appropriate Police complaints with all the necessary Orders and Documents an application can be made in  the same Court without being filed a new matter for contempt of Court. Police Complaint be filed and protection be sought.

name: Advocate Subhash C. Gulati
about: Advocate Subhash Gulati completed his law in the year 1982 and has been providing services in various fields of law, that is, Criminal, Cheque Bounce, Divorce, Arbitration, Cyber Crime and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents.
Advocate Subhash enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi in 1982. He is a member of the Delhi High Court Bar Association and New Delhi Bar Association.
